Class Counter

java.lang.Object
  Counter

public class Counter
extends java.lang.Object

This class is designed to be used as the superclass for different types of up-counters.

Version:
1.00 Feb. 14, 2012, 1.01 Feb. 15, 2012
Author:
D.L. Bailey, SCE, Carleton University

Constructor Summary
Counter()
          Constructs a new Counter whose current count is initialized to DEFAULT_MINIMUM, and which is intended to counts between DEFAULT_MINIMUM and DEFAULT_MAXIMUM, inclusive.
Counter(int minCount, int maxCount)
          Constructs a new Counter whose current count is initialized to minCount, and which is intended to count between minCount and maxCount, inclusive.
 
Method Summary
 void countUp()
          Increment this counter by 1.
 int getCount()
          Returns this counter's current count.
 boolean isAtMaximum()
          Determines if this counter is at its maximum value.
 boolean isAtMinimum()
          Determines if this counter is at its minimum value.
 int maximumCount()
          Returns the maximum value of this counter.
 int minimumCount()
          Returns the minimum value of this counter.
 void reset()
          Resets this counter to its minimum value.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
